situation: I am very scared about next college semester it is frightening

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: OK, sure. Can you tell me what the problem is? I'll do my best to help.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Well I am going into my next college semester next month, and I am very frightened about a calculus class I have to take. It's an honors course and I am very worried that I will not do well

situation: I have a ton of tests and projects all due very soon and it is during a time in which I had not seen any friends and am feeling down. I feel very overwhelmed and sad.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Procrastination never makes us feel good. If I keep putting something off, I then feel guilty. If I make a goal, and I reach it, I can put a reward. For example, if you study 3 subjects 1/2 hour each, you can go out for yogurt with a friend. So you reward yourself for sticking to that goal.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Yes, I did. lol I'm really old now. This technique I use in all my life. Even house chores, I break it down into a schedule, put it in writing, then check off what I do. Then I feel good about my accomplishments.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yes, that was my other question to you. It sounds great to just do a little time for each class but I often get overwhelmed and need a break

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I have never used check lists or planners. I think it is part of how I get overwhelmed maybe.

situation: I have a ton of tests and projects all due very soon and it is during a time in which I had not seen any friends and am feeling down. I feel very overwhelmed and sad.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: If you write your classes down and then write a reasonable time to study each one. Maybe 3 today, 3 tomorrow, then add rewards if you do that, maybe make a list of rewards, so you can pick and choose, then you check off when you do the subject.  Like a chore chart.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yes haha. That is a good comparison. You have been super helpful. I will for sure try to use your advice. Thank you!

situation: I have a ton of tests and projects all due very soon and it is during a time in which I had not seen any friends and am feeling down. I feel very overwhelmed and sad.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: So you have had a lot of stress with school lately and are struggling to keep yourself cheerful?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Is there something in particular at school that is stressing you out? Exams? Relationships?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yes! Its very hard to keep positive with all the work I have and I feel I am not doing well.

situation: i cant do well in school and they mock me

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I can understand why you would feel that way.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: You also sais there is a bully. Have you talked to anyone about this?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Bringing this up to a teacher can help. Have you tried that?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: none

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: no one seems to listen

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: cant get help from home am just depressed

situation: I found out that my boyfriend had been lying to me about his entire life, and so the future that he had said we were building towards was all but impossible. I'm trying to figure out if I should stay with him.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I'm debating. I don't know what to do.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I feel like a schmuck.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: He has such pretty words.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: From personal experience I think that if they say they're going to get divorced and then drag their feet it is never going to happen.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: And he invests so much time and effort into us.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I agree with you.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: My mind agrees.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: My stupid emotions are clouding things.

situation: I have a huge test coming up soon and I don't think I am ready for it.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Thank you! Do you think taking a practice exam would help?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: yes I think a practice exam would be a great way to put you at ease and help you work on anything you might need to freshen up on.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Ok, I will try that out. I appreciate talking to you I feel better already.

situation: Its not even a break up, my girlfriend wants space after 5 years, she wants to rent a room on her own without me, and it feels over.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Only you are responsible for you. I was with someone who, although we had great fun together, he couldn't be with me as much as I wanted him to. And it made me feel bad. Because it brought up feelings from when I was growing up and neglected.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: It took a long time, and it ...wasn't a clean break. I just got tired of feeling bad, and the relationship just waned.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Take the time you need, but you can take control, if you want to.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Right, it just feels crappy right now. literally yesterday her mom was telling me how happy she is that i take such good care of her daughter. I will have to just prioritize myself and hope it all works out. after 5 years its just hard

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: You said it, prioritize yourself. The rest will fall into place. It always does.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: thank you. i really appreciate it. i will do the best i can i promise.

situation: i cheated on her

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: ok, thats a good idea

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: There are also so many articles and support on the internet, don't be afraid to just search "getting over a relationship" or 'bad breakup advice"  there are so many people that have gone through this. Ypu are not alone.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I know that nothing I say can take away your pain or make it not have happened, but I care that you have these feelings and I care about you.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content:
thanks, i will 
check them out

situation: I am break up with my girl friend she love other one because that guy better than me he's very rice and got lot of money.  She's breaking up with me and she slapped me.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: No, i don't have part planned.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yeah, i am feelin good my friend.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Thank you very much.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I am very happy to hear that! I can see in your messages that you feel lighter.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Thank you very much for talking with me. I've enjoyed this conversation!

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Okey, thank you my friend.

situation: Current partner cheated on me in the past and I think he is doing it again.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I am having such a difficult time today!!!

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Can you tell me what is going on? I should be able to help you

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I think that my boyfriend is cheating on me again!!!

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Are you saying that he has cheated on you before? That does not sound very promising.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: He has but it was a long time ago and was before we had a talk about exclusivity in our relationship but it still hurt.

situation: Current partner cheated on me in the past and I think he is doing it again.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Maybe but a place that we won't get paid to go... I think he thought of it as a job or something. I got a lot out of the experience and still use the skills to this day. But with a unresponsive partner those skills will not work.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Can you recomend a good site to find affordable services?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: You could ask your doctor to recommend something that will not cost you too much but will be effective?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: That is a great idea I had not thought of asking my dr.

situation: Lost my job in the lockdown

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: ok understood. Have you had any depression issues during lockdown ?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content:
Once again I a, sorry to hear that you are depressed. Make sure to go ouside everyday. I have learned that healthy doses of sunshine help.
Yes I have often felt helpless due this pandemic.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I will say though that exercise, movies and lots of coffee have helped me.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I do tried watching movies in streaming platforms like Netflix and Prime. Did you tried the same ?

situation: I feel I am getting looked over for a promotion/raise at work and it is causing anxiety and fear that I don’t have longevity at my company and that I’m not being valued.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I think so! I have a cordial relationship with everyone, but I know my work speaks for itself. I think I need more confidence to ask for what I know I deserve.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Perhaps you could consider some sort of counselling to help you with you self esteem? I did it and it was great.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: That’s a really good idea. I think much of the anxiety I have with work stems from self esteem issues.

situation: I found out that my boss has not been paying me accurately.   I am so upset because I don't know what to do.  I feel like I should quit.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I can understand how you feel. Sometimes I let my anger get the best of me, but it is always important to remember to stay calm and think about your options and have a plan!

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I hope things go well for you!

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: And don't forget about asking for help! Sometimes that is the hardest part.

situation: Ever since the insurgent of Covid-19 ,I was hit hard when I was relieved from my full-time job for a non justifiable reason. I blame it to Covid because business was slow and it affected production. I was so frustrated and I didn't know what next to do as I had past due bills and family to take care of. I started applying for government benefits none was fast coming forth and requires a lot of processing time. I later got a part-time job that the pay was low and i could not put up with the bills .it was really tough. I almost went into depression but I did not give up home. Recently I got a full-time job but I have been scared and anxious because they keep laying off employees  weekly. I wouldn't want to go through the terrible situation I had last time.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: How are you doing today?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I am good. How may I assist you today!

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I would love some words of encouragement

situation: I have been laid out for not performing. But the acutal situation is the customer was satisfied my service. But the expectation of the management was not to do that.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I think motivation, self-development, getting more qualified is of my attention nowadays.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I understand and believe you have a great focus on a career. I am proud of you and your focus ability.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Fish tank is a better option. I forgot that. That is why I am more believing in the third angle. Thank you.

situation: I've made an accident at work in warehouse and didn't report it

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yeah I guess you are right. I just don't know what to do if I lose my job as now it's very hard to find a job

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Knowing the severity of the mistake, i think you should tell as good things come to people who are honest :)

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: But about your depression, try to occupy yourself with more work and maybe your boss will see that you have changed your ways

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Well knowing me the luck is not always on my side

situation: i am not abke to find work for over 6 months

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: what else can you recommend

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Are you eligible for unemployment benefits?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: no because I didnt lose my job coz of covid.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: is there anything else i can apply for

situation: I'm sad that my job is not fulfilling and I feel like I am wasting my life.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I am a maintenance supervisor in a manufacturing facility.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I have had jobs that seemed pointless as well.   I was a sales assistant in a store constantly waiting for customers, it was boring!  Just a paycheque with no fulfillment.  I found it depressing as well.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: So it sounds like you are finding no point to going in to work, and it's making you feel sad, am I correct?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yes that is a very good summary of what is going on. And I am glad to see you can relate. While I am lucky to not work in sales since I know those jobs are extremely tough but the lack of reward is all the same.

situation: Ex girlfriend issues.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: they have fathers. I am not involved like that. we had a short relationship and I am sure her girls will be bitter with me even tho i did the correct thing by turning her in.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: but the guilt from turning her in is terrible.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: You did the right thing. Would you have wanted the girls to end up as addicts, dead or in prison?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: She was not a good person. So it makes it easy to not regret it. but i still feel guilty. guilt caused issues last month when this all started and came to a head. it was a mess. I was a mess. things happened.

situation: I am scared to open myself up to others such as men because I do not want my heart to be broken but it is also due to my insecurities about my looks and weight.  there is one guy who likes me that live in france but I am not sure if I should pursue him or not.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: he understands that im not meeting him no time soon but when the pandemic is over I do not know if I should continue to pursue him or not

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I dont even have a passport and i care about my health and others im not traveling for a long time

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: So, I hear you saying that you are a bit wary of the relationship and do not know if it can work in the real world?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yes because I do not have experience with Turkish men and I am scared of him being controlling and abusive I guess its due to sterotypes i read about and heard

situation: I am very scare of this pandemic call COVID-19

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I don't like the noise of ambulance at all any time I see one I don't feel happy

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I can understand an ambulance sound is hard to hear, but even that can be turned around. You can pray for the person, then switch your mind off. If you focus on the negative, you will stay negative. If you do what you can (pray) then there is nothing else to do. Focusing on the negative will depress you.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: One thing I did to help with depression is keep a checklist of things to do when I felt down:  call a friend, call a loved one to encourage THEM, go for a walk, eat fruits and veggies, read a book, go for a bike ride, etc.  Things like that, then I chose to do those things despite how I felt. Doing those things helped my mood TREMENDOUSLY>

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Feelings follow thoughts. If you think negative thoughts, you will feel negative. If you think positive thoughts, you will feel positive. Sometimes this takes time, but it works.  Just because you feel sad doesn't mean you should just do nothing, a person can TALK their way out of sadness and choose to do something different.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Thanks your words of encouraging help me a lot

situation: Not being able to find a job after graduating from university

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Worst time to graduate

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Haven't even got the graduation ceremony lol

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: all you can honestly really do right now is to try to improve your resume and see if that helps any and just keep searching for jobs and putting in applications and i know you will get a call from a job soon

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: yes it has been a bad year for anything to happen

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yea that's what I am thinking of doing

situation: My husband and I constantly argue about discipline of our kids.

dialog.content: I am feeling really down.

dialog.content: I'm sorry to hear you're feeling that way, what has you feeling this way?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: My husband and I have 4 kids. One of those children is a child from his previous marriage. We constantly argue about how he favors that child over our other 3.

situation: my family neglected me

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: time is seriously hard, I'm thinking of other way to make money, before i finish my study

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I have just started using ibotta for my groceries... its not much but once i think ive finally got it figured out. I've been on reddit the past few days looking for websites like mturk but I havent tried any that i feel compare yet.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: ok

situation: the pandemic

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: yes of course.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: just the sense of fear, anxiety, and paranoia. And helplessness and anguish that people are complacent and selfish and stupid.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Keep reading up on exposure sites here like restaurants and gyms, and the culprits are those between 18-35 years old.

dialog.content: I've had similar feelings also. People can be very selfish right now. That's normal to feel that way!

dialog.content: How have you been coping with anxiety?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content:
yeah. Like I am scared of being sick at anytime. It could h
appen anytime.

i told him a secret about my self in private and he played a stupid pranks that reveals it to other people 
i don't like

dialog.content: he said he was drunk

situation: I am stuck in my house to protect my family from covid. All of my friends don't include me/talk to me anymore because I am no longer able to participate in their activities during the pandemic. They all left me and they used to be my best friends.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I never thought of that! That's is an amazing idea -- maybe I will look into that

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Thank you for talking with me today.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I am so glad I was able to help. Maybe we can try and set up another time to talk again?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Sure!

situation: I live with four friends/ housemates. I like them, but at the same time we are stuck together every day 24/7. Small things add up; I am getting increasingly annoyed by their behaviors and their inconsideration for others.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Do you have similar experience. I would like to know what you think

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I am quarantined with one of my friends and you know we are around each other 24/7 now to that she lost her job due to the pandemic. It does drive me crazy sometimes because i want some alone time but all i can really do at this point is just go outside and take a walk or just sit outside and that helps me most the time.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I will do more of that. I guess we are all making sacrifices and learning how to cope

situation: my friends refuse to take the pandemic seriously

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yes, I take it very seriously. I lost my grandfather to the illness earlier in the year and I also contracted it. I was sicker than I ever have been and I still can't smell or taste.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Oh wow, I'm very sorry to hear that! I'm sorry for your loss.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Do your friends know that you were sick or that you lost a loved one?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yeah they do which is why it's so frustrating to hear them talk about it not being real.

situation: I do not know  what Kingsley, my very close friend will be thinking right now. He asked me 1000 dollars that he will pay back in a week time, although I have the money but I have planned to get my wife a car  today.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: may be I should tell one of our friends that I think he is mad at me

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: if you are more comfortable texting him then i would suggest doing that but i would not just say nothing about you buying the car you should just let him know.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: so, we can  both settle the matter, I did not have  enough money to borrow him at that time because of my initial plan for my wife

dialog.speaker: seeker

situation: My youngest sister is battling with heroin addiction, and I am raising her two children.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I have a romantic partner who helps.  I also have two of my own relatively young children.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: So, four in total.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: That's a lot of children! It's great that you have a partner who can help you.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: A dear friend of mine is in rehab and had to give up her children, it is really awful to watch. It makes me feel so helpless, so i understand how you msut be feeling.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Thanks for being sympathetic and for the words of encouragement.  Yes, needless to say, Child Protective Services were involved, and I was granted Foster Parent status.  I'm sure your friend went down that road, sadly.

situation: My friends are  not taking the current pandemic seriously and often have get togethers.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: We feel like after this is all over, they will still remind us that we were standoffish during this time.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content:
And I agree. The longer we put it off and don't take it seriously, 
the longer it will last.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Can you tell them that that just isn't the case? You and your husband are making the right choice by staying home for the safety of yourselves and others. If I am correct, it has nothing to do with the fact that you don't want to see your pals and family!

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: From chatting with you it sounds like your relationships with these people is incredibly important to you.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yes that's totally accurate.
